segments.en: Hello, everyone.
segments.cn: 大家好。

segments.en: Welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name is Katherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine。

segments.en: So today we've got a great upper intermediate level lesson for our learners, and we're talking about what?
segments.cn: 今天我们为学习者准备了一节很棒的中高级课程，我们要讨论什么？

segments.en: Healthcare.
segments.cn: 医疗保健。

segments.en: Okay, this is a very important topic because it's been in the news recently, especially in the context of American politics.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一个非常重要的话题，因为最近它在新闻中频繁出现，尤其是在美国政治的背景下。

segments.en: And so I don't know if you've heard things about this, listeners, but healthcare is a very hot topic.
segments.cn: 所以我不知道你们听说过什么，听众们，但医疗保健是一个非常热门的话题。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 确实如此。

segments.en: So basically what we're talking about is health insurance, whether it's private health insurance or you know, like a standard national insurance program.
segments.cn: 我们讨论的基本上是健康保险，无论是私人健康保险还是像标准的国家保险计划。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 确实如此。

segments.en: And so your country might have a private option where you can pay a private company for insurance or public option like England or Australia, where your country will actually provide healthcare for you at no extra cost.
segments.cn: 所以你的国家可能有一个私人选项，你可以为保险支付私人公司，或者像英格兰或澳大利亚那样的公共选项，你的国家实际上会为你提供医疗保健而不收取额外费用。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So it's an interesting topic.
segments.cn: 这是一个有趣的话题。

segments.en: Why don't we jump directly into the dialogue and we'll be back to explain a couple of things.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不直接进入对话，稍后再回来解释一些事情。

segments.en: Hey, honey, how was your day?
segments.cn: 嘿，亲爱的，你今天过得怎么样？

segments.en: It was all right.
segments.cn: 还不错。

segments.en: I ran into Bill and we got to talking for a while.
segments.cn: 我遇到了Bill，我们聊了一会儿。

segments.en: He's in a bit of a jam.
segments.cn: 他遇到了一点麻烦。

segments.en: Why?
segments.cn: 为什么？

segments.en: What happened?
segments.cn: 发生了什么？

segments.en: Well, his son had an accident.
segments.cn: 嗯，他的儿子出了事故。

segments.en: Bill doesn't have health insurance.
segments.cn: Bill没有健康保险。

segments.en: This really got me thinking.
segments.cn: 这让我真的在思考。

segments.en: And I wondered if we shouldn't look into a couple of different HMOs.
segments.cn: 我在想我们是否应该考虑几种不同的HMO。

segments.en: Yeah, you're right.
segments.cn: 是的，你说得对。

segments.en: We aren't getting any younger and our kids are getting older.
segments.cn: 我们不再年轻了，孩子们也在长大。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 确实如此。

segments.en: I searched on the web and found a couple of HMOs with low co-pays and good coverage.
segments.cn: 我在网上搜索了一下，找到了几种低共付额和良好覆盖的HMO。

segments.en: The deductibles are low too.
segments.cn: 免赔额也很低。

segments.en: Sounds good.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: Although, do you think we can qualify for insurance?
segments.cn: 不过，你觉得我们能申请到保险吗？

segments.en: Those insurance companies are real pirates when it comes to money.
segments.cn: 那些保险公司在钱方面真是海盗。

segments.en: Well, we don't have any pre-existing illnesses or conditions, so we should be fine.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们没有任何既往疾病或状况，所以应该没问题。

segments.en: I wish our company or country provided us with health care.
segments.cn: 我希望我们的公司或国家能为我们提供医疗保健。

segments.en: Not in a million years.
segments.cn: 一百万年也不可能。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So a lot of interesting vocab here.
segments.cn: 这里有很多有趣的词汇。

segments.en: Why don't we take a look at it real fast in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不快速看一下语言要点。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: Okay, Marco, this first phrase or acronym actually is three words that go together, HMO, and they're very, very common when you're talking about health care.
segments.cn: 好的，Marco，这第一个短语或缩写实际上是三个词组合在一起，HMO，它们在谈论医疗保健时非常常见。

segments.en: Right, so an HMO means Health Maintenance Organization.
segments.cn: 对，所以HMO是健康维护组织的意思。

segments.en: Okay, and so this is a part of the health insurance topic where we're talking about a company that will provide health insurance.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们讨论健康保险时提到的一家公司，它会提供健康保险。

segments.en: Right, so it's a company that provides health insurance basically.
segments.cn: 对，所以它基本上是一家提供健康保险的公司。

segments.en: And if you go up to an HMO, some of the information that you'll receive is, for example, what your co-pay will be.
segments.cn: 如果你去找HMO，你会收到一些信息，例如，你的共付额是多少。

segments.en: Okay, so sometimes with a private option, when you pay a company to give you health insurance, you can get a lower rate if you help pay for some of your care.
segments.cn: 好的，所以有时在私人选项中，当你支付公司给你健康保险时，如果你帮助支付一些护理费用，你可以获得更低的费率。

segments.en: So, for example, a co-pay on a broken arm might be $20, but you pay $20, that's your co-pay, and your health insurance company pays the rest.
segments.cn: 例如，骨折的共付额可能是20美元，但你支付20美元，那就是你的共付额，而你的健康保险公司支付其余部分。

segments.en: And so sometimes co-pays are really high, they're really big, and that's kind of a bad deal because if you hurt yourself, you don't want to pay a lot.
segments.cn: 所以有时共付额真的很高，真的很大，这种情况就不好了，因为如果你受伤了，你不想支付很多。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: But sometimes there's no co-pay, in which case your company will pay for all of the coverage.
segments.cn: 但有时没有共付额，在这种情况下，你的公司会支付所有的覆盖费用。

segments.en: Alright, so another very similar word is a deductible.
segments.cn: 好的，另一个非常相似的词是免赔额。

segments.en: Okay, so deductible is something that is fixed and it's in your insurance policy.
segments.cn: 好的，免赔额是固定的，它在你的保险政策中。

segments.en: That means in the contract that you make with the insurance company, the deductible will be stated.
segments.cn: 这意味着在你与保险公司签订的合同中，免赔额会被说明。

segments.en: For example, my insurance plan, I have maybe a $500 deductible.
segments.cn: 例如，我的保险计划中，我可能有500美元的免赔额。

segments.en: That means that in any situation I get hurt or I get sick, I pay for the first $500 of care and then my insurance company pays for the rest.
segments.cn: 这意味着在任何情况下我受伤或生病，我支付前500美元的护理费用，然后我的保险公司支付其余部分。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So if I have to have a thousand dollar surgery, I pay $500 and then my insurance company pays the other $500.
segments.cn: 所以如果我需要进行一千美元的手术，我支付500美元，然后我的保险公司支付另外500美元。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And well, you have these deductibles and everything and that depends on your coverage, right?
segments.cn: 你有这些免赔额和一切，这取决于你的覆盖范围，对吧？

segments.en: So coverage, how much the HMO covers you.
segments.cn: 所以覆盖范围，就是HMO为你提供的保障。

segments.en: That's right, and so you can find this also in your contract with your insurance company and coverage will include or not include something.
segments.cn: 没错，所以你也可以在与保险公司的合同中找到这一点，覆盖范围将包括或不包括某些内容。

segments.en: So coverage, for example, in a health care plan does not usually include your teeth.
segments.cn: 所以例如，医疗保健计划中的覆盖范围通常不包括你的牙齿。

segments.en: That's a separate kind of insurance.
segments.cn: 那是另一种保险。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: But a coverage can include emergency evacuation from a situation or ambulances, for example.
segments.cn: 但覆盖范围可以包括紧急撤离或救护车，例如。

segments.en: And so coverage is what is included in your insurance plan.
segments.cn: 所以覆盖范围就是你保险计划中包含的内容。

segments.en: Okay, is to qualify for.
segments.cn: 好的，资格。

segments.en: All right, so you might have heard this phrase before in the context of sports or academics.
segments.cn: 好的，你可能在体育或学术的背景下听过这个短语。

segments.en: So he qualified for a scholarship or she qualified for the varsity volleyball team.
segments.cn: 所以他获得了奖学金，或者她获得了校队排球队的资格。

segments.en: But in this case to qualify for is to be able to use.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，资格是能够使用。

segments.en: To be eligible for.
segments.cn: 有资格。

segments.en: So sometimes HMOs like in, for example, the United States will not accept a person who has maybe some health problems already because that would be too much of a risk right for the company.
segments.cn: 所以有时HMO，比如在美国，可能不会接受已经有一些健康问题的人，因为这对公司来说风险太大。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Or you could qualify for a reduced rate because you have a very good health history.
segments.cn: 或者你可能因为有很好的健康记录而获得降低的费率。

segments.en: Okay, so this is very interesting and we have a couple of other phrases that are very related to this language.
segments.cn: 好的，这非常有趣，我们还有几个与此语言相关的短语。

segments.en: So why don't we move on now to fluency builder.
segments.cn: 所以我们现在为什么不继续进行流利度提升。

segments.en: Fluency builder.
segments.cn: 流利度提升。

segments.en: All right, so in fluency builder today, let's take a look at our first phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，在今天的流利度提升中，让我们看看我们的第一个短语。

segments.en: We got to talking for a while.
segments.cn: 我们聊了一会儿。

segments.en: Okay, we could say, for example, we started talking or we were talking for a while.
segments.cn: 好的，我们可以说，例如，我们开始聊天，或者我们聊了一会儿。

segments.en: But this is a very spoken language kind of phrase where we'd say we got to talking.
segments.cn: 但这是一个非常口语化的短语，我们会说我们聊了起来。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So it's not really grammatically correct.
segments.cn: 所以这并不是严格的语法正确。

segments.en: But because you would say we started talking, but sometimes people say we got to talking.
segments.cn: 但因为你会说我们开始聊天，但有时人们会说我们聊了起来。

segments.en: So we got into a conversation, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们进入了一个对话，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And usually it's about something.
segments.cn: 通常是关于某事。

segments.en: So we could say, yeah, we got to talking about how we both went to the same high school, or we got to talking about this movie that we both saw.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说，是的，我们聊了起来，谈论我们都上过同一所高中，或者我们聊了起来，谈论我们都看过的这部电影。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And well, they got to talking for a while.
segments.cn: 而且，他们聊了一会儿。

segments.en: And apparently his friend was in a bit of a jam.
segments.cn: 显然他的朋友遇到了一点麻烦。

segments.en: Okay, jam is a food, you can eat it, you put it on bread, like marmalade, right?
segments.cn: 好的，麻烦是食物，你可以吃它，你把它放在面包上，就像果酱，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 确实如此。

segments.en: But in this case, a jam is a fix or a difficult situation.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，麻烦是指困境或困难的情况。

segments.en: So it has a very different meaning.
segments.cn: 所以它有非常不同的含义。

segments.en: And I want to warn you about that first, but to be in a jam or to be in a bit of a jam is to be stuck.
segments.cn: 我想先提醒你这一点，但处于麻烦中或有点麻烦是指被困住。

segments.en: Okay, so you're in a difficult situation, you have some problem.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你处于困难的境地，有一些问题。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So Marco, I'm in a bit of a jam here.
segments.cn: 所以Marco，我有点麻烦。

segments.en: Can I get your help with something?
segments.cn: 我可以请你帮忙吗？

segments.en: All right, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: Okay, and then the guy was talking about insurance.
segments.cn: 好吧，然后那个人在谈论保险。

segments.en: And he said, this really got me thinking.
segments.cn: 他说，这让我开始思考。

segments.en: So we got the verb got again there.
segments.cn: 所以我们又有了动词“got”。

segments.en: All right, so got me thinking.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以“got me thinking”。

segments.en: That means I started thinking about something.
segments.cn: 这意味着我开始思考某事。

segments.en: So you know, when we were talking about jam a minute ago, it got me thinking about how much I love breakfast.
segments.cn: 所以你知道，当我们刚才谈论果酱时，这让我想到了我有多爱早餐。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So you would use it in that way, right?
segments.cn: 所以你会那样使用它，对吧？

segments.en: Like it reminded me, it reminded me or I started to really think about something.
segments.cn: 就像它让我想起了，我开始真正思考某事。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And our last phrase is a pre existing illness.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个短语是“既往疾病”。

segments.en: All right, so to exist is to be you know, to be around.
segments.cn: 好吧，存在就是存在，你知道的。

segments.en: pre existing means existing before something else.
segments.cn: “既往”意味着在其他事情之前存在。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And so you often hear this in terms of insurance, when someone asks you about your pre existing condition.
segments.cn: 所以你经常在保险方面听到这个，当有人问你关于你的既往病症时。

segments.en: So that means if I'm signing up for an insurance plan, health insurance plan, and I have an interview with you, Marco, and you asked me this question.
segments.cn: 这意味着如果我在注册一个健康保险计划时，和你，Marco，进行面谈，你问我这个问题。

segments.en: What is your pre existing condition?
segments.cn: 你的既往病症是什么？

segments.en: That means what diseases or health problems do I have now right now, right prior to signing up for this insurance?
segments.cn: 这意味着我现在有什么疾病或健康问题，正好是在注册这个保险之前？

segments.en: And I say, Oh, I don't have any and you're very happy because that means I'll be cheap.
segments.cn: 我说，哦，我没有任何问题，你很高兴，因为这意味着我会便宜。

segments.en: But um, if I say Oh, I have diabetes, then that is something that the insurance companies don't like because it's expensive.
segments.cn: 但是，如果我说，哦，我有糖尿病，那么保险公司就不喜欢，因为这很贵。

segments.en: Right?
segments.cn: 对吧？

segments.en: Because you're more probable of getting sick or something like that.
segments.cn: 因为你更可能生病或类似的事情。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So diabetes or cancer or Lyme disease, these are all pre existing conditions.
segments.cn: 所以糖尿病、癌症或莱姆病，这些都是既往病症。

segments.en: And usually pre existing conditions are diseases or problems, health problems that you have that won't go away.
segments.cn: 通常，既往病症是你有的不会消失的疾病或健康问题。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So we have a lot of words, a lot of phrases here.
segments.cn: 所以我们这里有很多单词，很多短语。

segments.en: Let's listen to the dialogue one last time, and we'll be back.
segments.cn: 让我们最后再听一次对话，然后我们会回来。

segments.en: Hey, honey, how was your day?
segments.cn: 嘿，亲爱的，你今天过得怎么样？

segments.en: It was all right.
segments.cn: 还不错。

segments.en: I ran into Bill and we got to talking for a while.
segments.cn: 我遇到了比尔，我们聊了一会儿。

segments.en: He's in a bit of a jam.
segments.cn: 他有点麻烦。

segments.en: Why?
segments.cn: 为什么？

segments.en: What happened?
segments.cn: 发生了什么？

segments.en: Well, his son had an accident.
segments.cn: 嗯，他的儿子出了事故。

segments.en: Bill doesn't have health insurance.
segments.cn: 比尔没有健康保险。

segments.en: This really got me thinking.
segments.cn: 这让我开始思考。

segments.en: And I wondered if we shouldn't look into a couple of different HMOs.
segments.cn: 我在想我们是否应该考虑几个不同的HMO。

segments.en: Yeah, you're right.
segments.cn: 是的，你说得对。

segments.en: We aren't getting any younger and our kids are getting older.
segments.cn: 我们没有变得更年轻，我们的孩子在长大。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: I searched on the web and found a couple of HMOs with low copays and good coverage.
segments.cn: 我在网上搜索，找到了几个低共付额和良好覆盖的HMO。

segments.en: The deductibles are low too.
segments.cn: 免赔额也很低。

segments.en: Sounds good.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: Although, do you think we can qualify for insurance?
segments.cn: 不过，你认为我们能符合保险资格吗？

segments.en: Those insurance companies are real pirates when it comes to money.
segments.cn: 那些保险公司在钱方面真是海盗。

segments.en: Well, we don't have any pre existing illnesses or conditions.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们没有任何既往疾病或病症。

segments.en: So we should be fine.
segments.cn: 所以我们应该没问题。

segments.en: I wish our company or country provided us with healthcare.
segments.cn: 我希望我们的公司或国家能为我们提供医疗保健。

segments.en: Not in a million years.
segments.cn: 一百万年也不可能。

segments.en: All right, so the healthcare issue is pretty heated debate now in the United States, because many people don't have health care and it's not very accessible, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以医疗保健问题在美国是一个相当激烈的辩论，因为很多人没有医疗保健，而且不太容易获得，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And it's a huge debate because it's very, very divided by party lines.
segments.cn: 这是一个巨大的辩论，因为它在党派之间非常分裂。

segments.en: We say, you know, there's the Republicans on the right, and there's the Democrats on the left.
segments.cn: 我们说，你知道，右边是共和党，左边是民主党。

segments.en: And the Democrats want a public health care option.
segments.cn: 民主党想要一个公共医疗保健选项。

segments.en: They want health care to be available for everyone for free.
segments.cn: 他们希望医疗保健对每个人都是免费的。

segments.en: And many of them do.
segments.cn: 他们中的许多人确实如此。

segments.en: And a lot of Republicans say no, it should be private, because if it's private, there's competition.
segments.cn: 很多共和党人说不，应该是私人的，因为如果是私人的，就有竞争。

segments.en: And that means there's better health care.
segments.cn: 这意味着医疗保健会更好。

segments.en: And so there's a really big debate and people are getting very angry about it.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常大的辩论，人们对此非常愤怒。

segments.en: Yeah, but I think it's something that's very interesting.
segments.cn: 是的，但我认为这是非常有趣的事情。

segments.en: And most importantly, seeing the difference of health care systems around the world, right?
segments.cn: 最重要的是，看到世界各地医疗保健系统的差异，对吧？

segments.en: So, for example, our listeners, there are from everywhere in the world.
segments.cn: 所以，例如，我们的听众来自世界各地。

segments.en: So we would like to know what the health care system is like there.
segments.cn: 我们想知道你们那里的医疗保健系统是怎样的。

segments.en: Do you have free universal health care in your country?
segments.cn: 你们的国家有免费的全民医疗保健吗？

segments.en: Or do you also have to pay for private companies or private health insurance?
segments.cn: 还是你们也必须为私人公司或私人健康保险付费？

segments.en: And if you have one or the other system, do you think it's a good thing?
segments.cn: 如果你们有其中一种系统，你认为这是好事吗？

segments.en: Do you think it's a bad thing?
segments.cn: 你认为这是坏事吗？

segments.en: What do you think needs some work?
segments.cn: 你认为需要改进的地方是什么？

segments.en: Right, I definitely agree with universal health care.
segments.cn: 对，我绝对同意全民医疗保健。

segments.en: I think it's a relief, because it's like one thing less to worry about.
segments.cn: 我认为这是一种解脱，因为这意味着少了一件担心的事情。

segments.en: I can't imagine like, you know, if I don't have health care right now, and I'm not covered by a private company, and something happens to me tomorrow, then you know, what's going to happen?
segments.cn: 我无法想象，如果我现在没有医疗保健，而且没有被私人公司覆盖，明天如果发生什么，我该怎么办？

segments.en: I think it's a basic human right, personally.
segments.cn: 我认为这是一项基本人权，个人而言。

segments.en: So I think it's in the best interests of a country to invest in it, because it means that their people are more productive and happier and healthy.
segments.cn: 所以我认为投资于此对一个国家是最有利的，因为这意味着他们的人民更有生产力、更快乐和健康。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So that's all the time we have for today.
segments.cn: 所以今天的时间就到这里。

segments.en: Be sure to come to EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 一定要来EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Leave your questions and comments.
segments.cn: 留下你的问题和评论。

segments.en: And we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye everyone.
segments.cn: 大家再见。
